summary: This document is a subpoena issued by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney to Jordana Feldman, the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP), commanding the production of documents related to the program and its claimants. It includes the subpoena form, proof of service instructions, and the full text of the EVCP Protocol detailing the program's administration and claims process.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in criminal case 20CR330, whose defense attorney is requesting the subpoena for documents from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Jordana Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The person to whom the subpoena is directed, responsible for administering the compensation program for victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell who requests and serves this subpoena.

persons.name: Kenneth R. Feinberg
persons.context: Retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Camille S. Biros
persons.context: Retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Marci A. Hamilton
persons.context: A professor and sexual abuse expert who may be consulted by the Program Administrator to inform about dynamics of sexual abuse and victims' rights.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose estate established the compensation program for victims of his alleged sexual abuse.

connections.description: Pagliuca is the defense attorney representing Maxwell in criminal case 20CR330, as indicated by his request for this subpoena.
Both were retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
Both were retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.
Feldman, as Administrator, may consult with Hamilton, a sexual abuse expert, to inform the Program's policies and review claimant files.
The document references individuals who have accused both Epstein and Maxwell of misconduct, linking them as co-accused in the context of the compensation program.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to EVCP Administrator
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney issues a subpoena to Jordana Feldman, Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, commanding production of documents related to the program and its claimants.

events.title: Epstein Victims' Compensation Program Protocol Established
events.description: The Protocol for the independent Epstein Victims' Compensation Program is finalized, outlining the process for victims to file claims against the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York, Courtroom 318, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team subpoenaed the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program for all claimant materials, communications, payments, and releases.
The subpoena seeks to obtain evidence from the compensation program that may be used in Maxwell's criminal defense (Case No. 20CR330).
The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was designed to be independent, voluntary, and confidential, with no cap on available funds for victims.
The program allowed victims to participate regardless of whether their claims were time-barred by statutes of limitations or if they had previously settled with Epstein.
The program protocol explicitly states that claimants are not bound by confidentiality rules and may discuss their allegations publicly, even after accepting compensation.
